intro: Centaurea segariensis, commonly known as the Segari thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges, and the flower heads are usually pink or purple in color. Centaurea segariensis is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, arid environments.
